"We already had three spinners in the squad...Chahar is a specialist in the T20 format and is a wicket-taker," stated Karim. Jadeja was replaced by Axar Patel after he was ruled out due to a right knee injury.

175.title: Pune women gang that stole mobile phones during Ganesh festival busted
175.article_body: Pune City Police has busted a women gang that stole mobile phones during the Ganesh festival and arrested its four members. Police recovered four mobile phones, worth ₹97,000, from them. "These women are habitual offenders and visit the city during big festivals like Ganpati, where large crowds come on the streets. They stay on footpaths...later sell the phones," police stated.

176.title: 2 die, 1 injured after overspeeding bike hits divider in Navi Mumbai
176.article_body: Two people died and one was seriously injured after their motorbike hit a divider on Palm Beach Road in Navi Mumbai. The incident reportedly occurred at around 11 pm on Sunday. According to police, the motorbike was being driven at a very high speed, which led to the accident. The injured person is being treated at a hospital, reports said.

177.title: Noise level crosses 'danger' mark in Mumbai during Ganpati Visarjan: NGO
177.article_body: The drums and loudspeakers used during Ganpati Visarjan this year contributed to making the noise level the highest ever in Mumbai, crossing the 'danger' mark, a city-based NGO said. According to data shared by Awaaz Foundation, the combination of drums and banjo used in processions created the highest noise at 115.6dB at Marine Drive's Babulnath corner and 112.1dB in Bandra.

178.title: People think back-seaters don't need belt: Gadkari after Cyrus Mistry's death
178.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has said the mindset of the common man needs to change to increase road safety. He said, "People think back-seaters don't need belts. It is the problem." Police probe into former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's death in the road accident on Sunday revealed he was in the backseat and was not wearing a seat belt.

179.title: 'No': US Prez Biden on designating Russia as state sponsor of terror
179.article_body: On being asked if Russia should be designated a state sponsor of terrorism, US President Joe Biden told reporters at the White House, "No." Ukraine's government has asked its Western partners to designate Russia as a "terrorist state" amid Moscow's ongoing invasion. Earlier, Russia had warned the US that such designation would rupture ties between both countries.

180.title: He kept a low profile despite his success: Shapoorji Pallonji Group on Mistry's death
180.article_body: After the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry in a road accident, Shapoorji Pallonji Group shared a condolence letter on social media. It wrote, "CPM, as he was fondly known, was a voracious reader, committed to a journey of lifelong learning across multiple disciplines. Despite his success, he always kept a low profile, away from the limelight."

181.title: Telugu is the new Hindi: RGV on 'Brahmastra' promotions in South
181.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter and talked about the promotions of 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad involving 'Baahubali' director SS Rajamouli and 'RRR' actor Jr NTR. "Going by Rajamouli and Jr NTR at the 'Brahmastra' event, Telugu is the new Hindi," Varma tweeted. 'Brahmastra' features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt and Nagarjuna. The film will release on September 9.

182.title: ATM refilling van driver flees with ₹2.80 cr cash in Mumbai, booked
182.article_body: The driver of an ATM refilling van allegedly fled with ₹2.80 crore cash in the vehicle in Mumbai on Monday. The incident occurred around 12.20 pm when the van reached Union Bank of India in Goregaon (west) and the employees got off the van to refill the ATM, police said. An FIR has been filed in connection with the case.

183.title: Pune residents asked to update Aadhaar, Collector calls for drive
183.article_body: Residents in Pune have been asked to update their information on Aadhaar. District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh on Monday called for a drive in this regard. "Many citizens have changed their addresses. Hence, we appeal to all residents to update information," said Deshmukh. Notably, Pune is one of the 40 districts selected by the central government for updating Aadhaar cards.

184.title: 2 members of drug cartel held in Delhi, 4.2 kg heroin worth ₹21 cr seized
184.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two members of an interstate drug cartel and seized 4.2 kilograms of heroin worth ₹21 crore. The cartel allegedly supplied more than 100 kilograms of heroin in Delhi in the past two years, police said. One of the accused used to prepare heroin in his village in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur, police further said.

185.title: Man running India-Pak cricket betting racket arrested in Pune
185.article_body: Pune City Police's crime branch unit 3 has arrested a 24-year-old man who was running a cricket betting racket during the India-Pakistan match. The arrest was made after police officers patrolling in Kothrud got a tip-off that the accused was standing near a pub, police said. Previously, the accused was arrested for running a betting racket in Pimpri-Chinchwad, police added.

186.title: Lucknow's Hotel Levana to be sealed, demolished after 4 people killed in fire
186.article_body: Hotel Levana in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow will be sealed and demolished, following the death of four people in a fire that broke out at the hotel on Monday. The owners of the hotel have been detained. Rescue work had started soon after fire broke out. Reports said that the hotel operators had not taken the NOC of the fire department.

187.title: Bengaluru reports 276 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
187.article_body: Bengaluru reported 276 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,66,836 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Monday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 3,228, while the infection positivity rate stood at 3.57%.

188.title: Highest rainfall in B'luru in 32 yrs; K'taka govt releases ₹300 cr to tackle flooding
188.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said that Bengaluru has received the highest rainfall in the last 32 years. The state government has decided to release ₹300 crore to tackle the flooding in Bengaluru amid heavy rain, he added. The released money will be used to restore infrastructure such as roads, electric poles, transformers and schools, among others, Bommai stated.

189.title: One suspect in Canada mass stabbing that killed 10 found dead
189.article_body: Canada police have said that one of the two suspects in Sunday's mass stabbing in Saskatchewan has been found dead. The other suspect, his brother, was still on the run and may be injured, officials added. The brothers Damien and Myles Sanderson are suspected of murdering 10 people and wounding 18 in the attack that targeted an indigenous community.

190.title: Russia permanently bans 25 Americans, including Sean Penn, from entering the country
190.article_body: Russia imposed personal sanctions on 25 Americans, including actors Sean Penn and Ben Stiller, in response to US sanctions against Russians amid Ukraine war. Russia said the group, which also includes business leaders, academics and government officials, would be banned permanently from entering Russia. Notably, Penn and Stiller previously traveled to Ukraine and met President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

191.title: Heard of Piastri-McLaren contract later than July 4 date: Alpine F1
191.article_body: Alpine F1 boss Otmar Szafnauer said they got to know about Oscar Piastri and McLaren's contract much later than the July 4 date they claimed to have signed the deal. "Up until that point, it was just conjecture," said Szafnauer, adding they were pursuing their contract with Piastri. An F1 Board recently ruled in favour of Piastri's contract with McLaren.

192.title: Priti Patel resigns as UK Home Secretary hours after Liz Truss named PM
192.article_body: Britain's Home Secretary Priti Patel on Monday announced she's stepping down from her post, hours after Liz Truss was named the Prime Minister. "I congratulate Liz Truss on being elected our new Leader, and will give her my support as our new Prime Minister," said Patel in her resignation letter. "It's my choice to continue...public service...from the backbenches," said Patel.

193.title: SEBI gives in-principle approval to Helios Capital for mutual fund business
193.article_body: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has given in-principle approval to Helios Capital to launch a mutual fund business. The portfolio management services business, Helios Capital Management PTE Limited, applied for a mutual fund license in February 2021. Founder and Fund Manager Samir Arora announced the approval on Twitter and added that they will focus on performance and service.

194.title: With Medvedev out, Nadal leading race to end US Open as world no. 1
194.article_body: Daniil Medvedev is set to be replaced as world number one by Rafael Nadal, Carlos Alcaraz or Casper Ruud after the US Open. With Medvedev losing to Nick Kyrgios in the Round of 16, Rafael Nadal would become the top-ranked player if he reaches the finals. Ruud or Alcaraz could also take the spot if they win the tournament.

195.title: Tripura CM meets PM Modi, discusses state issues
195.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi. Saha said that he told the PM about the progress of various projects in health, education, commerce, infrastructure development and ongoing projects of central and state governments. "Hon'ble PM assured about extending Centre's necessary assistance for overall development in Tripura," Saha wrote on Twitter.

196.title: Macron urges French to save energy amid EU-Russia tensions
196.article_body: Amid tensions between Russia and the EU over the war in Ukraine, French President Emmanuel Macron has urged the people of his country to adopt energy-saving measures in order to avoid power cuts during winter. Macron on Monday warned that power rationing could be introduced if voluntary efforts don't suffice. He added that "cuts will happen as a last resort".

197.title: Minimum 2 more years in F1, then Dakar Rally: Fernando Alonso
197.article_body: Two-time F1 world champion Fernando Alonso said he wishes to continue in the sport for a minimum of two more years. "And then, from there, a challenge that I have never hidden is to try the Dakar (Rally) again," said Alonso. He added that he was moving to Aston Martin from Alpine next year because he felt more wanted there.

198.title: Getting threats for doing Ganesh Puja at home: UP BJP's Ruby Khan
198.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Muslim BJP leader Ruby Asif Khan allegedly received death threats for bringing home and worshipping a Ganesh idol. A fatwa has also reportedly been issued against her by Deoband Mufti Arshad Farooqui who called her action 'un-Islamic'. Stating that she is not afraid of the threats, she said she would also immerse the Ganesh idol with due diligence.

199.title: Real Madrid's Brazilian attacker Vinicius Jr adopts Spain citizenship
199.article_body: Real Madrid attacker Vinicius Junior, who holds a Brazilian passport, has now also adopted Spanish citizenship. Under La Liga rules, a club can only have five non-EU players in their squad, thus Vinicius' move helps free up a spot for Real Madrid. Reports claim players Rodrygo Goes and Eder Militao are also in the process of obtaining their Spanish passports.

200.title: 'India's biggest car thief' who stole over 5,000 cars in 24 years, arrested in Delhi
200.article_body: An auto theft kingpin, whom the police referred to as "India's biggest car thief", was arrested by Delhi Police on Monday. Anil Chauhan, who started stealing cars in 1998, has looted over 5,000 cars across the country and police found illegal firearms and ammunition with him. Around 180 criminal cases including rhino horn smuggling and murders are registered against him.

201.title: Ukrainian PM asks EU for more weapons, offers gas supplies
201.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal on Monday urged the EU to provide Ukraine with more weapons in order to strengthen its capabilities in the ongoing war against Russia. Shmyhal further suggested that Ukraine could supply the gas that the EU needs to reduce its dependence on Russia. Notably, Russia last week indefinitely suspended gas supply to Europe through a key pipeline.

202.title: Contractual Army cook arrested for stalking minor on social media
202.article_body: A 21-year-old contractual cook of the Indian Army was arrested by Delhi Police for allegedly stalking and harassing a 17-year-old girl on social media after she ended their friendship. The girl had befriended him through TikTok and exchanged numbers, police said. The accused allegedly created her multiple fake accounts on social media platforms and made vulgar posts using her pictures.

203.title: Find music & acting to be opposite in many ways: Harry Styles
203.article_body: Singer-actor Harry Styles said he finds acting and creating music "kind of opposite in a lot of ways". The actor said making music is a "really personal thing", while acting is mostly about "playing pretend". "Music I've done for longer, but what I like about acting is I feel like I have no idea what I'm doing," he said.

204.title: It was beautiful, hats off to groundsmen: Ravi on pitch in Ind-Pak game
204.article_body: Cricket commentator Ravi Shastri said that the pitch in the India-Pakistan match at the Dubai International Stadium was "beautiful". "What...Rohit [Sharma and KL] Rahul...were doing. Where were the runs coming? It was down the ground and in the V," Shastri said. He added, "It was a beautiful pitch, hats off to the groundsmen, the ball was skidding onto the bat."

205.title: Amazon looking to enter prescription drug market in Japan: Report
205.article_body: Amazon Inc is reportedly looking to enter the prescription drug market in Japan. Next year, when electronic prescriptions are allowed for the first time in Japan, Amazon plans to partner with small and mid-sized pharmacies to provide the service. Currently, the government of Japan sets the price cap for prescription drugs in a highly fragmented distribution system.

206.title: We are a democratic party, people can air their views openly: Cong
206.article_body: The Congress asserted that it is a democratic party and allows leaders to express themselves following criticism by the BJP and former member Ghulam Nabi Azad. "Some (leaders) write letters, some tweet, some give an interview...There is no dictatorship...we don't silence anyone," said Jairam Ramesh. Both BJP and Azad had told the Congress to concentrate on uniting the party first.

207.title: 80-yr-old Congress leader from Haridwar, Harpal Sathi, joins BJP
207.article_body: Senior Congress leader from Haridwar, Harpal Singh Sathi, joined BJP along with his supporters in the presence of Uttarakhand BJP President Mahendra Bhatt. On joining BJP, 80-year-old Sathi said that the BJP was his family and he was returning to it after realising his mistake. Sathi is a three-time former MP from Haridwar and won twice on a BJP ticket.

208.title: Funding winter for startups to continue for 12-18 months: Report
208.article_body: According to a report by market intelligence platform Tracxn, funding winter (low investor confidence in startups) in India is likely to continue for the next 12-18 months. The report added that August 2022 saw $885 million in funding, which was down 20% compared to July 2022. In the maximum total funding raised, Bengaluru was in the lead, the report stated.

209.title: Who are the ICC Player of the Month nominees for August?
209.article_body: The ICC on Monday announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of August. England's Ben Stokes, Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza and New Zealand's Mitchell Santner have been nominated for ICC Men's Player of the Month award, while Australia's Beth Mooney and Tahlia McGrath, and India's Jemimah Rodrigues have been nominated in the women's category.

210.title: Seema Sajdeh reacts to troll saying she's 'no more a B'wood wife' after divorce
210.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Seema Sajdeh, who recently got divorced from actor-filmmaker Sohail Khan, responded to a troll who asked why she is still a part of the show as she is no longer a 'Bollywood wife'. "I didn't know women were defined by their husbands and their last name. Is that their only identity?" Seema said.

211.title: Teachers, your contribution to society is priceless: Kohli on Teachers' Day
211.article_body: India batter Virat Kohli took to Twitter on the occasion of Teachers' Day on Monday and wrote, "To all our teachers and mentors, your contribution to our society is priceless." Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Amongst all the education and morals my teachers sincerely imparted, I'm most grateful to them for teaching me...values of hard work, honesty and never giving up."

212.title: Nataraj idol stolen from Tamil Nadu temple 62 yrs ago traced to US
212.article_body: A Nataraj idol, stolen 62 years ago from a temple in Tamil Nadu’s Thanjavur, was traced to New York, USA by the CID’s idol wing. After thieves broke into the 2000-year-old temple and stole an idol, the CID found that it is fake and the original was missing. Officials said the original idol is being retrieved under UNESCO agreements.

213.title: Pics of revamped Central Vista Avenue released ahead of inauguration this week
213.article_body: New pictures of the refurbished Central Vista Avenue in New Delhi have been released ahead of its scheduled inauguration on September 8 (Thursday). The pictures show red granite walkways, revamped canals and a fountain amid lush greenery. Food stalls from all the different states will be put up in the area when it is thrown open to the public.

214.title: Chip in car can give vital info on Cyrus Mistry's accident: Police
214.article_body: Just like an aircraft's blackbox, Mercedes cars have a chip that can give details of the speed and can provide vital information of the accident that killed former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, police said. This comes after the car Mistry was travelling in was inspected by Mercedes officials. The accident spot and vehicle were also inspected by forensic experts.

215.title: Speeding truck kills police constable in Jaipur; driver arrested
215.article_body: A police constable died after being hit by a speeding truck on the Jaipur-Delhi national highway near Daulatpura village in Jaipur, Rajasthan. The deceased, Dharmendra Kumar (37), was part of an interceptor and died while trying to stop the truck for over speed, police said. Notably, the truck driver has been arrested and the vehicle seized, police added.

216.title: Girl kills father with grinding stone in Ghaziabad to save mother
216.article_body: A 16-year-old girl killed her father with a grinding stone in Ghaziabad after being fed up with him beating her mother with a belt. The teenager and mother have both been booked for murder. During interrogation, the woman said that the man was having an affair and used to regularly beat her and the children, said police.

217.title: 5 arrested for ransacking traffic police booth in Chennai
217.article_body: Five people have been arrested for allegedly ransacking a traffic police booth in Chennai. According to police, a construction supervisor was attacked by some people after he tried to stop one of them from stealing construction materials. The supervisor ran to the booth to escape. The attackers then hurled stones at the booth and damaged its windows and doors.

218.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant disconnected from power grid: Ukraine
218.article_body: Ukraine's electricity grid lost connection with the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant as the result of a fire caused by Russian shelling on Monday, the plant's operator Energoatom said. The reserve line through which power was being supplied to the grid "was deliberately disconnected in order to extinguish a fire", the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said citing Ukrainian authorities.

219.title: There was no need to play that shot: Akram on Pant's dismissal
219.article_body: Former cricketer Wasim Akram commented on India's wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's dismissal against Pakistan on Sunday after the latter got out playing a reverse sweep shot. "At that stage of the game, there was no need to play that shot. I know he plays that shot in Test cricket...but in this stage of the game, that shot wasn't required," Akram said.

220.title: Saying nasty things about him does nobody any good: Bhogle on Arshdeep
220.article_body: Defending Arshdeep Singh after the pacer got abused on social media for dropping a catch in India's five-wicket defeat against Pakistan at Asia Cup, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Saying nasty things about Arshdeep does nobody any good." He added, "We've all made mistakes under pressure. This is the time to back him. He will win India a lot of matches."

221.title: Joined BJP as our win in Manipur was mandate to NDA: Ex-JD(U) legislators
221.article_body: We joined BJP as our win in the Manipur Assembly elections was a mandate to the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), the five former JD(U) legislators who joined BJP on Friday said. "We fought elections for the NDA government...We joined BJP as we had no option as [JD(U)] withdrew from the NDA," said Joykisan Singh, one of the legislators.

222.title: M Venture Partners raises over $25 mn for MVP Fund I
222.article_body: Singapore-based early-stage venture capital (VC) fund M Venture Partners (MVP) has raised an additional capital of over $25 million. The total capital allocated to MVP Fund I companies is now more than $55 million. Launched in 2019, MVP Fund I has now invested in 30 companies across Southeast Asia and India, and its portfolio companies include Naluri, Liquide and NewCampus.

223.title: I wake up in disbelief that this is my life, that I'm an actor: Ranveer Singh
223.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said, "I'm...grateful that I get to be an actor and that's actually enough for me." "I've always said...it's a miracle that I even became an actor," he added. "Every day, I wake up in disbelief that this is my life, that I'm an actor and I get to do these things, collaborate with...talented filmmakers," Ranveer said.

224.title: Anyone chosen as Cong Prez by consensus acceptable to G-23: Chavan
224.article_body: Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan said a party President chosen by consensus would be acceptable to the G-23 dissenters. He said the President could be Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot or any leader if chosen by general agreement. He also backed Shashi Tharoor's demand to make public the electoral rolls of the Congress President polls to be held on October 17.

225.title: Brendan Fraser breaks down as The Whale gets 6-min standing ovation at film fest
225.article_body: Actor Brendan Fraser, known for 'The Mummy' films, broke into tears after his film 'The Whale' received a six-minute-long standing ovation at Venice Film Festival 2022. The film, directed by Darren Aronofsky, features Brendan as a 600-pound (over 270 kg) gay professor who tries to reconnect with his 17-year-old daughter. The film was screened at the festival on September 4.

226.title: Windfall tax on petroleum products, crude isn't ad hoc: Sitharaman
226.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said windfall tax on petroleum products and crude is not ad hoc. She said that it's being charged in regular consultation with the industry. The tax rate and its resetting are done in complete consultations with the industry, she said, adding, "The very idea was implemented after taking the industry into full confidence."

227.title: Film will be new & fresh: Ayan on fans' concern on 'Brahmastra' promos
227.article_body: 'Brahmastra: Part One-Shiva' makers have been sharing new promos of the film ahead of its release, which has left the fans concerned. On Monday, Ayan Mukerji addressed the fans' concerns and told them not to worry as the film will be "new and fresh" on screen. He assured fans that the "actual movie is a whole other experience".

228.title: Didn't get India's team selection or playing style: Shoaib Akhtar
228.article_body: Former Pakistani bowler Shoaib Akhtar said he is "confused" with India's team selection and manner of playing. "India's team came across a very confusing selection for me...whoever is coming, is just hitting...someone has to anchor the innings," said Akhtar. He added that after Pakistan's first match loss, he had told everyone that they would beat India "ruthlessly" next time.

229.title: Nuclear-capable US bombers fly over Middle East amid tensions with Iran
229.article_body: Amid tensions between Washington and Tehran, the US said that a pair of its nuclear-capable B-52 long-distance bombers made a sortie over the Middle East on Sunday. The bombers took off from an airbase in England and flew over the eastern Mediterranean, the Arabian Peninsula and the Red Sea with Saudi and Kuwaiti warplanes as part of a training mission.

230.title: I want to generate jobs, but some are obstructing by filing PILs: Mamata
230.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she wants to "generate jobs" for the aspirants of the School Service Commission (SSC) but some people are "obstructing" the process and filing PILs for the same. "Some people want to politicise the matter and are filing PILs to stop the process. If you file cases, the process will take time," she said.

231.title: Kanye was upset that I supported Joe Biden over him as President: John Legend
231.article_body: Singer John Legend said Kanye West was "very upset" with him after he supported Joe Biden over him in the 2020 US presidential election. Kanye announced his presidential election campaign in July 2020. In reference to his friendship with Ye, John said he believes that "relationships with people shouldn't only be determined by who they voted for".

232.title: Hope Lewandowski can win the Ballon d'Or in 2022: Puyol
232.article_body: Ex-Barcelona captain Carles Puyol said he hopes Robert Lewandowski can win the Ballon d'Or this year. "He deserves it for the good years he has had and now he has to win it at Barcelona. It'll be a good sign," he added. "He's one of the best strikers in...world," he further said. Barcelona signed Lewandowski from Bayern Munich in July.

233.title: Will shave my beard after 8 years if I win 2nd World Cup: France's Giroud
233.article_body: France forward Oliver Giroud said he would "have to do something a little crazy" and shave his beard if he won the World Cup for the second time. "It's been a long time, it's been almost eight years," said Giroud about shaving his beard. Defending champions France will open their 2022 FIFA World Cup campaign on November 22 against Australia.

234.title: Revenue-based financing firm Klub closes ₹200 cr maiden fund
234.article_body: Revenue-based financing platform Klub announced the final close of its maiden ₹200 crore fund, Aceler8. It is a SEBI-registered Category II Alternative Investment Fund and has already deployed 30% of its corpus. The fund invests capital between ₹5 lakh to ₹30 crore in businesses for up to 24 months and has made 33 investments over the last few months.

235.title: Had no money to celebrate b'day when I was young, now I've no desire: Pankaj
235.article_body: Pankaj Tripathi, who turned 46 on Monday, remembered that when he was young, he didn't have money to enjoy his special day. Now, when he can afford to celebrate his birthday, Tripathi said he has no desire to make noise. "The age to enjoy birthdays is gone," he said, adding, "A quiet day with the family is all I want."

236.title: India are playing good cricket: SL captain Shanaka ahead of Asia Cup game
236.article_body: Ahead of India-Sri Lanka Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022, Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka said India have been playing good cricket. "They (India) had a great game last night...I don't think they will be under pressure," he added. The match will be played on Tuesday. Sri Lanka are currently on top of the Super 4 points table.

237.title: Healthledger Diagnostics raises undisclosed amount of seed funding
237.article_body: Healthledger Diagnostics has raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding from angel investors and venture capitalists. The transactions were enabled by Quadra Capital Advisors and include VCs Nitish Mittersain and Vikash Mittersain of Nazara Technologies and lifestyle coach Luke Coutinho, among others, the company said. The firm claims to have generated $1 million revenue in its inception year.

238.title: Central govt provide armed CISF cover to RSS offices in Delhi
238.article_body: The RSS offices in Delhi have been provided with an armed Central Industrial Security Force cover by the Central government. According to PTI, the organisation's main 'Keshav Kunj' office located at Jhandewalan and its camp office located nearby at 'Udasin Ashram' have been brought under the CISF cover beginning September 1. Notably, the cover was sanctioned by the Home Ministry.

239.title: Court not a tool for your resume: HC to student who sought ₹15 lakh over pollution in Delhi
239.article_body: Dismissing his petition seeking grant of ₹15-lakh compensation from the government on the ground of air pollution in Delhi, the High Court told a law student that the right to file a case before the court is not merely a tool for resume. "Sir remember, the court is a serious place," Justice Yashwant Varma told the petitioner.

240.title: Can students wear minis in colleges?: SC while hearing plea against hijab ban
240.article_body: Supreme Court Justice Hemant Gupta asked if students were allowed to dress in "minis, midis, whatever they want" in colleges while hearing a plea challenging the ban on hijab in government colleges in Karnataka. The apex court bench said, "They (authorities) are not denying the right to education. What they are saying as State, is you come in the uniform."

241.title: Jaffer, Mishra troll Barmy Army for calling Ashes bigger than India-Pakistan rivalry
241.article_body: Wasim Jaffer and Amit Mishra trolled England's Barmy Army for tweeting, "Ashes > India vs Pakistan anyway." Jaffer wrote, "If I was an England fan, with the Ashes record England has, I'd downplay the Ashes if anything." Meanwhile, Mishra posted a picture of Russian President Vladimir Putin and ex-England captain Nasser Hussain and wrote, "Difference between #IndvsPak & Ashes."

242.title: You inspire me so much: Kriti Sanon on Pankaj Tripathi's birthday
242.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon on Monday wished Pankaj Tripathi on his birthday. Taking to her Instagram Stories, she wrote, "Happy Birthday Pankaj Sir! You inspire me so much...Have done a few of my best films with you and I hope I get to do many more!" The duo have worked together in films like 'Bachchhan Paandey', 'Mimi' and 'Bareilly Ki Barfi'.

243.title: SRK's Red Chillies acquires remake rights of 'Dulhe Raja': Reports
243.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment has reportedly acquired the negative and remake rights of 1998 film 'Dulhe Raja'. As per reports, director Farhad Samji is working on the script of the film. "If the screenplay is faithful adaptation and actors show keen interest, Red Chillies will be more than happy to remake the film," a source informed Pinkvilla.

244.title: Can’t expect govt to provide security to pvt hospitals: Supreme Court
244.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday said it can't be expected from the central and state governments to provide security to private hospitals. It was hearing a plea seeking direction to the government to ensure adequate security at hospitals to prevent attacks on doctors. "The private centres must make their own security arrangement. You cannot burden the government," the court said.

245.title: Fans get emotional and say a few words, we don't have a problem: Arshdeep Singh's father
245.article_body: Talking about his son getting abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup, India pacer Arshdeep Singh's father Darshan Singh said, "Fans get emotional, angry when their team loses and say a few words." He added, "We're taking it positively and there's no problem." "People have a habit to say...let them say," Arshdeep's mother said.

246.title: Instagram fined $400 million by Ireland for violating children's privacy
246.article_body: Meta-owned Instagram has been fined €405 million (around $402 million) for allegedly violating children's privacy, including the publication of children's email addresses and phone numbers. The fine has been levied by the Irish DPC and is the second highest fine under the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Instagram is the third Meta-owned company fined by the Irish DPC.

247.title: Ricky Ponting names his 5 players for World T20I XI
247.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has named the first five players he would choose in his world T20I XI. He included Afghanistan's Rashid Khan, Pakistan's Babar Azam, India's Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah, and England's Jos Buttler. "Right now he's probably the best all-rounder in the world in T20 cricket, and could potentially be in ODI cricket," Ponting said about Pandya.

248.title: 2 dead, many missing after boat with 23 fishermen capsizes in Kerala
248.article_body: Two fishermen were killed and many went missing after a boat carrying about 23 people capsized near Anchuthengu Harbour in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram on Monday. According to police, 16 people have been rescued so far. The injured were shifted to Chirayinkeezhu hospital for treatment. The Indian Coast Guard and locals are searching for the missing persons.

249.title: 19-year-old Palestinian man shot dead by Israeli forces
249.article_body: A 19-year-old Palestinian man was killed in a clash with Israeli forces that broke out during an arrest raid in West Bank on Monday, Palestinian officials said. Israeli military said that its soldiers resorted to retaliatory firing after the man threw a firebomb at troops from close range. Militant group Islamic Jihad claimed that the deceased was one its members.

250.title: Journalist Shireen Abu Akleh likely killed by soldier: Israeli army
250.article_body: The Israeli army on Monday announced the results of its investigation into the killing of Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, saying it was "highly possible" that she was killed by an Israeli soldier's gunfire. However, no one would be punished as the shooting was accidental, army added. Akleh was killed in May while covering a military raid in West Bank.

251.title: India's monetary policy will remain watchful, calibrated: RBI Guv
251.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Monday said that India's monetary policy will remain watchful, nimble-footed and calibrated going forward. He further said India's central bank has intervened in forex markets to prevent excessive volatility in the exchange rate. He noted that the Indian rupee had moved in an orderly manner during sharp depreciations in other currencies.

252.title: Football-size tumour removed from Nepalese woman's stomach in Delhi
252.article_body: A football-size tumour, weighing around four kg, was removed from the stomach of a 32-year-old woman from Nepal at a private hospital in Delhi. The woman had come to the hospital with complaints of extreme pain and an oversized stomach. A doctor said that removing the tumour was like delivering a large size baby as in a caesarean section.

253.title: Mastercard replaces Paytm as BCCI's title sponsor for 2022-23 season
253.article_body: Global payments giant Mastercard has replaced Paytm as the title sponsor of the Board of Control for Cricket in India. Mastercard has announced that it has acquired the BCCI's title sponsorship rights for all international (both women and men) and domestic matches for the 2022-23 season. Notably, Paytm held the rights for seven years as the title sponsor of BCCI.

254.title: Wimbledon finalist Jabeur reaches her first-ever quarter-final at US Open
254.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Ons Jabeur defeated 18th seed Veronika Kudermetova 7-6(7-1), 6-4 in the fourth round to enter her maiden quarter-final at US Open. "It was a very difficult match," said Jabeur. Notably, the Tunisian became the first Arab woman to reach the last eight in New York. Jabeur will now face Ajla Tomljanovic, who beat Liudmila Samsonova 7-6(10-8), 6-1.

255.title: Platforms like Twitter can't decide what is free speech: Centre to HC
255.article_body: The Centre told the High Court on Thursday that intermediary platforms like Twitter can't "define what free speech is and what's not". Twitter's petition challenging action against multiple handles is not maintainable, the Centre said while adding that Twitter's content management policies are "a failure". Twitter isn't taking effective steps to prevent the spread of fake news, the Centre said.

256.title: We have left behind those who ruled us for 250 years: PM Modi
256.article_body: As India surpassed the UK to become the fifth-largest economy, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said, "Achieving this spot is special as we have left behind those who ruled over us for 250 years." The PM was interacting with National Award-winning teachers. "Our new National Education Policy (NEP) is being applauded throughout the world," PM Modi added.

257.title: Vijay Deverakonda's 'Jana Gana Mana' shelved following Liger's box office failure: Report
257.article_body: Following Liger's box office failure, Vijay Deverakonda's next film 'Jana Gana Mana', which was also to be directed by Puri Jagannadh, has been shelved, Hindustan Times reported. As per trade sources, Liger managed to earn just ₹35 crore across India in its opening weekend. Earlier, it was announced that 'Jana Gana Mana' will be released in August 2023.

258.title: Odisha Juggernauts win the inaugural edition of Ultimate Kho Kho
258.article_body: Odisha Juggernauts won the title at the inaugural edition of Ultimate Kho Kho after beating Telugu Yoddhas 46-45 in the final in Pune on Sunday. Odisha Juggernauts were awarded ₹1 crore in prize money, while the second-placed Telugu Yoddhas won ₹50 lakh. Gujarat Giants bagged ₹30 lakh for their third-place finish.

259.title: Can't you see it's a throwback photo, chomu aadmi: Sanjana to troll over pic with Bumrah
259.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's wife, TV presenter Sanjana Ganesan, responded to a troll who commented on her Instagram picture with Bumrah. "Waha India ki *** ***** pade hue hai or yeh gum rahe," the troll wrote, mocking Bumrah for not being in India squad for Asia Cup. Sanjana responded, "It's a throwback photo, can't you see, chomu aadmi?"

260.title: He looked very good: Gambhir on Kohli's 60 vs Pakistan at Asia Cup
260.article_body: Commenting on India batter Virat Kohli's 44-ball 60 against Pakistan in Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Gautam Gambhir said, "Kohli looked very, very good." He added, "Kohli...coming back after the way he batted in...first and second game just showed that probably he got that confidence back especially today." It was Kohli's second consecutive half-century in the tournament.

261.title: 60-80% Twitter accounts posting on Russia-Ukraine war may be bots: Study
261.article_body: A research by scholars from Australia's University of Adelaide has revealed that between 60-80% of Twitter handles posting on the Russia-Ukraine war may be bot accounts. These bot accounts may have been pushing people to flee their homes during the conflict, the research said. Of accounts tweeting on the war, 90.16% were "pro Ukraine" while only 6.8% were "pro Russia".

262.title: Tonight you saw, rankings don't matter: Kyrgios on beating world no. 1 Medvedev
262.article_body: After defeating world number one and defending champion Daniil Medvedev in the fourth round at US Open 2022, world number 25 Nick Kyrgios said, "Tonight was another message that the rankings don't matter." He added, "I don't care whether I'm seeded or not. It's nice otherwise I could draw him [in] first round." Kyrgios beat Medvedev 7-6(13-11), 3-6, 6-3, 6-2.

263.title: India's external debt grew by 8.2% in 2021-22: Finance Ministry
263.article_body: India's external debt grew by 8.2% to $620.70 billion on March 31, 2022, from $573.7 billion a year ago, Union Finance Ministry said. External debt as a ratio to GDP fell marginally to 19.9% at the end of March 2022, it added. Foreign currency reserves as a ratio to external debt stood slightly lower at 97.8% as of March-end 2022.

264.title: India to design, build reusable rocket for global market: ISRO
264.article_body: India has plans to design and build a new reusable rocket for the global market, that would significantly cut the cost of launching satellites, a senior Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) official said on Monday. “All of us want launches to be much cheaper than what we do today,” ISRO Chairman S Somanath further said.

265.title: 14,500 schools to be developed, upgraded: PM Modi on Teachers' Day
265.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on the occasion of Teachers' Day on Monday announced that 14,500 schools across India will be developed and upgraded under the Pradhan Mantri Schools For Rising India (PM-SHRI) Yojana. "These will become model schools which will encapsulate the full spirit of [National Education Policy]," he said. These will put emphasis on a discovery-oriented, learning-centric way of teaching.

266.title: American filmmaker Gunn reacts to Chiranjeevi's 'Mr Batman' avatar in old song
266.article_body: American filmmaker James Gunn, known for films like 'Guardians of the Galaxy' and 'The Suicide Squad', has shared a video of a song from Chiranjeevi's 1993 Telugu film 'Mutamestri'. In the video shared by Gunn, the actor could be seen dancing in a Batman costume. "First there was Batman, then The Batman, and now MR. BATMAN," Gunn wrote.

267.title: Aamir Khan's brother Faissal Khan rejects 'Bigg Boss 16'
267.article_body: Actor Faissal Khan, brother of Aamir Khan, took to Instagram to share a video revealing that he was approached for Salman Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' but he rejected the offer. He added that he was also offered a TV show. "I'm quite excited...people are...considering me. Please pray for me...I get some good work so I can...entertain you all," said Faissal.

268.title: Bihar's political upheaval unlikely to have nationwide impact: Prashant Kishor
268.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Monday said that the political upheaval in Bihar, which saw JD(U) breaking its alliance with BJP, was a "state-specific" phenomenon and is unlikely to have a nationwide effect. Kishor added that the upheaval was symbolic of the "political instability" that has plagued Bihar since the rise of the "new BJP" under PM Narendra Modi's leadership.

269.title: 11-yr-old missing boy found dead inside a madrasa in Haryana
269.article_body: An 11-year-old boy was found dead inside a madrasa in Shah Chaukha village in Haryana's Nuh district. The deceased, Sameer, went missing from the same Madrasa on Saturday and police recovered his decomposed body from an old room. Half of the deceased's body was covered with sand, the complaint said. Sameer was staying and studying in the madrasa since 2021.

270.title: Free power supply to all farmers if non-BJP govt comes in 2024: KCR
270.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday announced "free power supply to all farmers in the country if a non-BJP government comes to power in 2024". He was speaking at a public meeting in Nizamabad. Days ago at another event, Rao had called for "BJP-mukt Bharat". He had said the BJP was responsible for all major problems afflicting the country.

271.title: Indian Army chief Gen Pande made honorary General of Nepali Army
271.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande was conferred the honorary rank of "General of the Nepali Army" by Nepal's President Bidya Devi Bhandari on Monday. The practice follows the seven-decade-old tradition between India and Nepal where both countries confer the title of honorary General to each other's army chiefs. General Pande is currently on a five-day official visit to Nepal.

272.title: India's services sector PMI grows from 4-month low to 57.2 in Aug
272.article_body: India's services sector saw improvement in August from a four-month low Purchasing Managers' Index in July. The S&P Global India Services PMI rose to 57.2 in August from July's 55.5. "Business confidence strengthened substantially, reaching its highest since May 2018, while employment rose at...fastest pace in over 14 years," Pollyanna De Lima, Economics Associate Director at S&P Global said.

273.title: Delhi L-G sends legal notice to Atishi, other AAP leaders for defamation
273.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena on Monday sent a legal notice to AAP leaders, including MLAs Atishi and Saurabh Bharadwaj, for levelling "derogatory" charges against him. Earlier, AAP had alleged that Saxena pressured his employees to exchange demonetised notes worth ₹1,400 crore in 2016 when he was chairman of a government Khadi body. AAP demanded his resignation and arrest.

274.title: MP woman fights off tiger, saves 15-month-old son from its jaws
274.article_body: A woman in her 20s repeatedly hit a tiger with her bare hands to save her 15-month-old son in the Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve in Madhya Pradesh's Umaria district, officials said on Monday. The tiger, that had held the child by its jaws, later mauled the woman, who sustained a fracture to her neck. Some villagers reportedly chased away the tiger.

275.title: Messi, Mbappe, Neymar need to accept that they won't play all games: PSG coach
275.article_body: PSG coach Christophe Galtier said that the club's players, including Lionel Messi, Kylian Mbappe and Neymar, will have to sit out from the matches at times. "We play a lot, every three days, then every four days, then there is the World Cup. Everyone has to understand that they won't be able to play all the games," Galtier said.

276.title: Bihar teacher harasses student for rejecting proposal, made to do sit-ups
276.article_body: A video has gone viral from Bihar, which shows villagers forcing a teacher to do sit-ups after he proposed a girl student that he used to teach. According to reports, the girl took tuition from him and rejected his proposal when the accused made advances. The accused started eve-teasing and harassing her, following which he was made to do sit-ups.

277.title: Kenya's top court upholds William Ruto's election as president
277.article_body: Kenya's Supreme Court on Monday unanimously upheld the election of William Ruto as the country's president in the August 9 polls. Runner-up candidate Raila Odinga had challenged Ruto's victory in the top court, alleging ballot rigging and other irregularities. Two affidavits alleging tampering with polling station result forms were dismissed by the court as "double hearsay".

278.title: Aakash Chopra changes his Twitter DP in support of Arshdeep who got abused for catch drop
278.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra changed his Twitter DP to that of Arshdeep Singh's photo to support the Team India fast bowler, who got abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup. Earlier, the Indian government summoned executives of Wikipedia after Arshdeep's page information was changed to reflect an association with Khalistan.

279.title: 7 killed in Hungary after train collides with car
279.article_body: A train collided with a car at a level crossing in southern Hungary on Monday, killing all seven occupants of the car, local authorities said. According to police, the driver of the train was rushed to a hospital with minor injuries. The level crossing where the incident took place had no gate or electric signal, Hungary's state railway company said.

280.title: Delhi's historic Rajpath & Central Vista lawns renamed 'Kartavya Path' by govt
280.article_body: Centre on Monday announced that the Rajpath (formerly 'Kingsway') and Central Vista lawns area in New Delhi will be renamed 'Kartavya Path'. Rajpath is the boulevard that runs from the Rashtrapati Bhawan through Vijay Chowk and India Gate, National War Memorial to National Stadium. This comes days ahead of the scheduled reopening of the refurbished Central Vista on September 8.

281.title: PayU's acquisition of BillDesk for $4.7 billion approved by CCI
281.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved the $4.7-billion acquisition of payment gateway BillDesk by Prosus' PayU. It is said to be the largest acquisition in India's digital payments space. The acquisition was announced in August last year. With the deal, PayU will now operate in more than 20 markets.

282.title: Well done girls, you are so amazing: SRK on his team TKR winning women's CPL
282.article_body: Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan congratulated his team, Trinbago Knight Riders, for lifting the trophy of the Women's Caribbean Premier League on Sunday. "Every victory is special...but somehow this one for TKR women's squad is well, most special. Well done girls you are all so beautiful and amazing," SRK tweeted. Notably, the actor owns TKR and KKR cricket teams.

283.title: 2 killed in flash flood in Kerala, IMD issues red alert in 4 districts
283.article_body: Two persons, including an eight-year-old girl, died in a flash flood at Mankayam waterfalls in Kerala's Palode town on Sunday, said police. They were a part of a group of 10 people. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert in four districts including, Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta and Idukki, for Tuesday.

284.title: SpiceJet needs ₹2,000 crore to continue flying: Report
284.article_body: Budget carrier SpiceJet needs recapitalisation to keep flying and compete with existing and new airlines, industry watchers reportedly told Livemint. The airline has reportedly said that its board had approved raising up to ₹2,000 crore amid high fuel prices and depreciation of the rupee. Notably, SpiceJet on Wednesday posted a worse-than-expected net loss of ₹789 crore for the April-June quarter.

285.title: 4 including 4-yr-old electrocuted to death in Assam; 2 others hurt
285.article_body: Four persons, including a four-year-old child, were electrocuted to death in Assam's Hailakandi district on Sunday evening. According to police, the incident took place when the child touched a live electric wire fallen on the ground and his parents and neighbours rushed to save him, but also got electrocuted in the process. Two others have sustained injuries in the incident.

286.title: Kerala tattoo artist accused of rape, sexual assault reopens studio
286.article_body: Tattoo artist Sujeesh PS, who had been arrested on March 5 after several women accused him of sexual abuse and rape, has reopened his tattoo studio 'Inkfected' in Kerala's Kochi. At least six women filed sexual assault complaints against him after an 18-year-old girl, in an anonymous post on Reddit, alleged she was raped in the tattoo studio by him.

287.title: 'Baahubali' was very similar to 'Karan Arjun': Rakesh Roshan
287.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said in an interview that SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' was "very similar" to his 1995 film 'Karan Arjun'. "But it was presented on a bigger scale. Even...songs were larger-than-life and hence people were enticed," he added. "In...South, they're still sticking to rooted stories," he said, adding that Bollywood filmmakers have "drifted away from the roots of Indianness".

288.title: Hope we play like this only: Nawaz on Pakistan's 5-wicket win vs India
288.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Muhammad Nawaz said he hopes that the team will continue to play as they performed in their five-wicket win against India in the Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022 on Sunday. Nawaz was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 42 runs and 1/25. Pakistan chased the 182-run target on the penultimate ball of the match.

289.title: 2 policemen injured in accidental firing at training centre in Himachal
289.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) and a Head Constable suffered injuries after a gun was accidentally fired at the Police Training College in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district on Sunday. The victims are instructors at the centre. "A bullet got stuck in a gun during firing training. The two instructors were trying to fix it when the weapon misfired," said an official.

290.title: Aditi Rao Hydari shares pic with Mani Ratnam on Teachers' Day, pens note
290.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari took to Instagram on Monday to share a picture with filmmaker Mani Ratnam on the occasion of Teachers' Day. She wrote, "Be curious, admit mistakes, learn, evolve...Know whom to listen to and what to absorb and what to discard!" "To every teacher I've had every step of the way, Happy Teachers' day," Aditi added.

291.title: Society chairman, a Dawood associate, is threatening us: Malad residents
291.article_body: Residents of a high-rise building in Mumbai's Malad have written to the police requesting a suo moto case against the society's chairman. The residents claimed chairman Sonu Jalan has been threatening them, insulting women and misappropriating society funds. Residents say they are afraid of filing a case by themselves as Jalan is allegedly a close associate of Dawood Ibrahim.

292.title: Prez Murmu walks down the podium to honour differently-abled teacher, video goes viral
292.article_body: While conferring National Awards to teachers on the occasion of Teachers' Day, President Droupadi Murmu walked down the podium to honour a differently-abled teacher. Sharing a video, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan tweeted, "This heartwarming gesture...is a sweet reminder of her humility, rootedness and compassion. President Murmu is an inspiration when it comes to ideal public values."

293.title: Rape survivor fails 'virginity test' in Rajasthan, fined ₹10 lakh by Khap Panchayat
293.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly tortured, beaten and forced to undergo a 'virginity test' on the first day of her marriage in Rajasthan's Bhilwara. A ₹10 lakh penalty was also imposed on the rape survivor by the Khap Panchayat after she failed the test. Despite knowing about the rape, the woman's father-in-law made her go through the humiliation, said police.

294.title: Waste dumped in Navi Mumbai mangroves rising: Activists to Maha CM
294.article_body: Environmentalists have written to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde about the waste accumulated in Navi Mumbai mangroves. The letter sought stringent penalties and imprisonment for repeat offenders stating that medical waste, including syringes, has been found in the mangroves. Environmentalists say despite a dozen NGOs working on clean-up drives, the amount of waste keeps increasing.

295.title: India hands over body of terrorist, who died of cardiac arrest, to Pak
295.article_body: The body of a fidayeen suicide attacker from PoK, who was captured by Indian Army during an infiltration attempt in Jammu and Kashmir, has been handed over to Pakistan. The 32-year-old terrorist, identified as Tabarak Hussain, was injured in Army firing during his infiltration attempt and later he died of cardiac arrest on Saturday. He's reportedly a trained Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist.

296.title: Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan to undergo MRI scan for right leg strain
296.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan will undergo a precautionary MRI scan today after sustaining a strain in his right leg during the five-wicket win over India in the Super 4 stage of Asia Cup 2022 on Sunday. The 30-year-old was reportedly shifted to a hospital soon after Pakistan’s last-over victory. Rizwan scored a match-winning 51-ball 71 against India.

297.title: My body made me beauty queen & mother, gotta love it both ways: Neha
297.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said people's opinion on her body doesn't upset her because it gave her "two amazing humans", daughter Mehr and son Guriq. "This body made me a beauty queen and this body made me a mother. I gotta love it both ways," she said. She added she wants to set "realistic standards for myself and everyone else".

298.title: PM Modi congratulates Liz Truss for being elected as UK's third woman PM
298.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated UK's Prime Minister-elect Liz Truss. "Confident that under your leadership, the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership will be further strengthened. Wish you the very best for your new role and responsibilities," PM Modi tweeted. Truss, UK's former Foreign Minister, was elected as UK's third woman PM on Monday after securing 81,326 votes.

299.title: President Murmu presents National Teachers' Award to 45 teachers
299.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Monday presented the National Teachers' Award to 45 teachers from across the country for their work in the education sector. The awards were presented during an event in Delhi on the occasion of Teacher's Day. President Murmu said science, research and innovation are the basis of development in today's knowledge economy.

300.title: Karnataka seer found dead at Guru Madiwaleshwar Mutt, suicide suspected
300.article_body: A seer of Karnataka's Sri Guru Madiwaleshwar Mutt was found dead inside the mutt in Belagavi district on Monday. Police suspect that he died by suicide. The seer was reportedly upset over a video in which two women were seen discussing the alleged cases of sexual assault in some mutts. His name was also mentioned in the video.

301.title: Punjab minister talks to Arshdeep's mother on phone after he gets abused, shares video
301.article_body: Punjab Sports Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer shared a video posted by AAP wherein he can be seen talking to pacer Arshdeep Singh's mother Baljit Kaur after he got abused online for dropping a catch against Pakistan. "Entire Punjab, entire nation is with...Arshdeep...When he returns, I will go with you to receive him from the airport," he told Baljit.

302.title: Pa Ranjith's best work: Rajinikanth on 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu'
302.article_body: Director Pa Ranjith took to Twitter and shared Rajinikanth's review for his film 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu'. He said Rajinikanth called the film his "best work in terms of direction, writing, casting, cinematography and music". Pa Ranjith said he was "extremely touched by" Rajinikanth's appreciation. 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu' starred Kalidas Jayaram, Kalaiyarasan Harikrishnan and others.

303.title: Delhi BJP MLAs seek dismissal of AAP govt, to meet Prez tomorrow
303.article_body: BJP leader Ramvir Singh Bidhuri has said that all BJP MLAs in Delhi will meet President Droupadi Murmu tomorrow and demand the dismissal of the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government in the national capital. Bidhuri said they'll give a memorandum over the same to President Murmu. This comes amid a controversy over a CBI investigation into the now-scrapped Delhi excise policy.

304.title: New Data Protection Bill, IT Act to make online world more accountable: Vaishnaw
304.article_body: Electronics and Information Technology Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Monday said the government is coming up with a new version of the Data Protection Bill and the amendment to the IT Act 2000, known as the Digital India Act. "What we are looking at is making the online world more accountable for what is being published there," Vaishnaw said.

305.title: Man robbed of e-rickshaw at gunpoint by 4 suspects in Delhi
305.article_body: A man was robbed of his e-rickshaw at gunpoint by four suspects in north Delhi's Burfkhana Chowk on Monday. The victim, Sushil Kumar, was going to his home in Malkaganj when the incident happened, police said. The unidentified accused threatened Sushil with a country-made weapon. Notably, a case has been registered under sections 392, 397 and 34 of IPC.

306.title: Sood Charity Foundation fulfilling my dream of becoming teacher: Sonu
306.article_body: Sonu Sood said if he wasn't an actor, he would have been a teacher. He said his dream is now coming true with 'Sood Charity Foundation', which is helping many students to pursue education. Calling his mother his "favourite teacher", Sonu shared, "Since my mother was a teacher herself, there was no excuse for me to have secured less marks."

307.title: Forced population control measures can be dangerous: Jaishankar
307.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday said that he is against forced population control measures and that a move in that direction will have very dangerous consequences, as it can create gender imbalance. "The rate of growth of the Indian population is falling. The reason is education, social awareness and prosperity," he added.

308.title: Man stabs transgender wife for singing songs in public in Bihar
308.article_body: A man stabbed his transgender wife in Bihar after she went to sing celebratory songs at other people's houses, even after his objection, reports said. The accused beat her up initially, but later stabbed her three times in her stomach using a knife. The accused had also tried to convince his wife to leave her line of work, reports said.

309.title: SC to hear Amazon's plea against CCI's suspension of Amazon-Future deal
309.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear Amazon's plea against Competition Commission of India's (CCI) order to hold its approval for Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Group's Future Coupons Private Limited (FCPL). The court has sought a reply from the concerned parties and will hear the case on September 19. Amazon moved the SC after NCLAT upheld CCI's decision.

310.title: No one has put gun on makers' head: Johar on charging big amount for judging shows
310.article_body: Karan Johar, who returned to television screens as the judge of 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', has reacted to reports of him charging a big amount for the reality show. "I don't think anyone gets what they don't deserve. No one has put a gun on their head. So whatever money I earn is for a reason," Johar said.

311.title: Can't permit this: Minister on distortion of Arshdeep's Wikipedia page
311.article_body: While addressing the distortion of Indian cricketer Arshdeep Singh's Wikipedia page, after India's loss to Pakistan on Sunday, Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar said that no intermediary operating in India can permit this type of misinformation. The left-arm pacer faced trolling on social media after he dropped a catch in the dying embers of India's Asia Cup clash with Pakistan.

312.title: 12-year-old girl bitten by stray dog dies in Kerala
312.article_body: Despite receiving three doses of the anti-rabies vaccine, a 12-year-old girl, who was bitten by a stray dog, has died at Kottayam Medical College in Kerala. She was on ventilator support after being bitten by the dog several times on August 14. Kerala Health Minister Veena George had ordered the setting up of a medical board to treat the girl.

313.title: Cyber frauds pose as Army men, cheat father-son of ₹2 lakh in Pune
313.article_body: Cyber criminals allegedly posing as senior Army officers cheated a father-son duo to the tune of ₹2 lakh in the Pune district recently, police said on Monday. The accused allegedly showed interest in the victims' property and asked them to transfer money to 'establish a contact', police said. They even showed fake identity documents to gain trust, police added.

314.title: 2 steal gold worth ₹1.24 cr from jewellery store in Mumbai, held
314.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly stealing gold ornaments worth ₹1.24 crore from a jewellery store in central Mumbai, police said on Monday. The accused had broken into the store between 2 pm and 5 pm on August 24 and escaped with 2.4 kg of gold ornaments, an official said. Six teams were formed to track them down.

315.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' to release on OTT in October: Reports
315.article_body: Aamir Khan had earlier stated that his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' will premiere on OTT platform after six months of its theatrical release. Now, owing to its poor performance at the box office, the makers have reportedly decided to release 'Laal Singh Chaddha' on OTT on October 20. The film also starred Kareena Kapoor Khan in a pivotal role.

316.title: CM Shinde-led Sena is real Shiv Sena, it is with BJP: Amit Shah
316.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena is the real Shiv Sena and it is with the BJP. "Uddhav Thackeray betrayed the BJP after seeking votes on the names of Narendra Modi and Devendra Fadnavis. Time has come to show Thackeray his place," said Shah.

317.title: Pune minor girls, who left home due to father's drinking habit, found
317.article_body: Two girls aged 12 and 13, who went missing from Pune district's Maval tehsil, were found on the Panvel-Nanded train in Osmanabad, police said. The girls had gone to school on Saturday but did not return home. Police said the girls were fed up with their father's drinking habit and he used to beat them up.

318.title: Radhika Madan, Nimrat Kaur announce their film 'Happy Teachers' Day'
318.article_body: Radhika Madan and Nimrat Kaur on Monday announced their upcoming film, titled 'Happy Teachers' Day', which will be produced by Dinesh Vijan's Maddock Films. Director Mikhil Musale called 'Happy Teachers' Day' a very special film, saying that it came to life "after 2 years of rigorous hard work". He thanked producers for giving him the opportunity to tell this story.

319.title: Neetu, Sunny Kaushal & Shraddha Srinath to feature in Lionsgate India's film
319.article_body: Lionsgate India announced its foray into feature film production with Neetu Kapoor, Sunny Kaushal and Shraddha Srinath's upcoming untitled Hindi film. Neetu said the script of the film moves beyond "the regular mother-son story", while Sunny called the film "an ode to all the mothers, their wishes and sacrifices". Shraddha described the film's script as "sweet, warm and delightful".

320.title: Ghulam Nabi shot himself in foot by quitting Congress: Digvijaya Singh
320.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh criticised former party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad over his exit from the party last month. "Ghulam Nabi Azad, by resigning from Congress, has shot himself in the foot," Singh added. "He may find something, somewhere, but nothing can match the honour and respect that Congress accorded to him," Singh further said.

321.title: Karnakata rape-accused mutt seer sent to judicial custody till Sept 14
321.article_body: A Chitradurga district court sent Murugha mutt chief Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, the primary accused in a rape case, to judicial custody till September 14. Shivamurthy's counsel moved a bail application, and the court has directed the public prosecutor to file objections to the bail. The Karnataka Police arrested the seer on September 1 for allegedly raping two minor students.

322.title: Case filed against YouTube channel over prank videos in Coimbatore
322.article_body: The Coimbatore Police filed a suo moto case against a YouTube channel named 'Kovai 360' for recording prank videos in public places, said officials on Monday. The channel, which has about 18 lakh subscribers, had been uploading prank videos involving women, elderly and others without their consent, said police. The police warned of strict action in such cases.

323.title: Gauff becomes youngest American woman to reach US Open quarters since 2009
323.article_body: US' Coco Gauff reached her maiden quarter-final at US Open after beating China's Shuai Zhang 7-5, 7-5 on Sunday. With the win, 18-year-old Gauff became the youngest American woman to reach US Open quarter-final since Melanie Oudin in 2009. Gauff will face 17th seed Caroline Garcia, who defeated Alison Riske-Amritraj 6-4, 6-1 to enter her first quarter-final in New York.

324.title: Over-speeding kills 1 person every 6 minutes in India: Govt data
324.article_body: Over-speeding kills a person every six minutes and injures one every two minutes in India. As per the NCRB data, 87,050 people were killed and 2,28,274 injured in over-speeding incidents last year. A preliminary probe into former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's death revealed that not "wearing seat belt, over-speeding and error of judgment" resulted in the fatal car crash.

325.title: CBI denies Sisodia's claims that officer died by suicide due to pressure to frame him
325.article_body: The CBI denied Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's claims that a CBI officer died by suicide due to pressure to frame the AAP leader in the Delhi Excise Policy 'scam' case. "We strongly refute mischievous and misleading statement by Sisodia. It's clarified that gentleman officer late Jitendra Kumar was in no way connected with the investigation of the case."

326.title: Gurugram Police head constable arrested in bribery case
326.article_body: Haryana's State Vigilance Bureau arrested a head constable of Gurugram's DLF Phase 2 Police Station red-handed while accepting a bribe of ₹2,000 in lieu of getting a compromise in a road accident case. The state vigilance bureau has registered an FIR against the suspect, Pradeep, under the anti-corruption act. The complaint was filed by Nikhil, a native of Uttar Pradesh.

327.title: Man falls while alighting from moving train in Pune, saved by RPF
327.article_body: A passenger fell into the gap between a train and platform while trying to get down from the moving train at Pune station. He'd fallen asleep and missed getting down at the station. After realising the train had started pulling out, he tried to get down and fell. However, his life was saved after RPF policemen immediately pulled him out.

328.title: Death toll due to earthquake in China's Sichuan province reaches 21
328.article_body: The death toll from the magnitude 6.8 earthquake that hit China's Sichuan province on Monday has risen to 21. Landslides triggered by the earthquake were reported in multiple parts of the province, as per state media reports. Some roads and homes near the epicentre were damaged by landslides. The provincial power grid is also said to be affected.

329.title: Sri Lanka forms committee for repatriation of refugees from India
329.article_body: Sri Lanka's government on Monday said that it has appointed a committee to facilitate the return of Sri Lankan refugees from India. Only 3,800 Sri Lankans currently residing in India are willing to come back, the government said. Lakhs of Sri Lankan Tamils had sought refuge in India during the course of the Sri Lankan civil war.

330.title: Free education to girls, 10 lakh jobs to youth: Rahul Gandhi in Gujarat
330.article_body: Ahead of Gujarat polls, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi promised free education for girl students and jobs for the unemployed. “We will open 3,000 English medium schools and will give free education to girls. BJP government had shut thousands of schools. I want to end unemployment...The focus will be to give employment to 10 lakh youth in Gujarat,” said Rahul.

331.title: Raj Kundra approached for 'Bigg Boss 16': Reports
331.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra, husband of actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra, has been approached for 'Bigg Boss 16', as per reports. "They feel the real side and the truth needs to be shown in front of the country," a source was quoted as saying. Raj was arrested in a pornography case in July 2021 and was released in September.

332.title: Arshdeep dropping such an easy catch was a bit surprising: Rajkumar
332.article_body: Reacting to India pacer Arshdeep Singh dropping a catch against Pakistan during their Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said it was surprising to see such an easy catch dropped. Arshdeep put down a sitter while Asif Ali was batting at zero in 18th over of Pakistan's innings. Ali scored 16 (8).

333.title: Anurag Thakur calls AAP government 'bewdi sarkar'
333.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised AAP government and called it a "bewdi sarkar". He alleged that Delhi CM and his deputy were involved in the liquor scam with mafia. "They are encouraging the liquor mafia. AAP doesn’t have an answer to it. It is a corrupt government. This is the identity of Arvind Kejriwal-led bewdi sarkar," said Thakur.

334.title: Novaya Gazeta newspaper's media license revoked by Russian court
334.article_body: A Russian court revoked the media license of Novaya Gazeta newspaper on Monday. Russia's media watchdog Rozkomnadzor had moved court in July accusing Novaya Gazeta of not providing documents related to a change of ownership in 2006 and sought cancellation of its license. Notably, the newspaper ceased operations when Russia tightened rules for covering the conflict in Ukraine.

335.title: BJP's 'sting' video is a 'joke', I have stings as well: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia
335.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday questioned the veracity of BJP's 'sting video' regarding his involvement in the excise policy scam and called it a joke, adding that he has such videos as well. The video reveals that 80% of the profit will go to Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia and their friend, said BJP's Sambit Patra.

336.title: Liz Truss named as UK's next Prime Minister
336.article_body: Liz Truss has been named as the leader of the Conservative Party and UK's new Prime Minister after defeating Rishi Sunak, the former finance minister. UK caretaker PM Boris Johnson will travel to Scotland to meet Queen Elizabeth on Tuesday and officially tender his resignation. Former foreign minister Truss promised to act quickly to tackle UK's cost of living crisis.

337.title: Some faulty project reports responsible for road accidents: Gadkari
337.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday attributed some of the road accidents to few faulty project reports. "Some DPRs (Detailed Project Reports) prepared by companies are worst and are responsible for road accidents," Gadkari said. Furthermore, he said, "Beginning should be made from DPR. If the companies preparing DPRs do not improve, the problem will reoccur."

338.title: Ghaziabad Police arrests gang of drug smugglers with heroin worth ₹1 cr
338.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have arrested five people, including a woman, for allegedly smuggling heroin worth approximately ₹1 crore from Jharkhand to other states, officials said Sunday. The accused often changed cars, switched off their phones and would cut off all communication until the drugs were delivered to the buyer at a given location and time, reports said.

339.title: I'd love to be Hrithik's bouncer for a day: 'Babli Bouncer' actress Tamannaah
339.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia called Hrithik Roshan and Vicky Kaushal her favourites during the trailer launch of her upcoming movie 'Babli Bouncer'. "I would love to be Hrithik's bouncer for a day. I would also love to be Vicky's bouncer," she added. The film, directed by Madhur Bhandarkar, will feature Tamannaah as a female bouncer.

340.title: The way Bishnoi handled power play, dismissed Babar was fantastic: Irfan
340.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said the way India's 22-year-old spinner Ravi Bishnoi handled the power play and picked Pakistan captain Babar Azam's wicket in the fourth over was "fantastic". Irfan added, "It is not easy, the pressure on the Indian bowlers during the game against Pakistan is a lot and Bishnoi handled the pressure very well."

341.title: Police constable suspended over video of him fighting with home guard in UP
341.article_body: A police constable was suspended after a video showing him fighting with a home guard in Uttar Pradesh's Jalaun surfaced on social media. The video, shot by a passerby, shows the two fighting at a roadside while a third official tried to stop them. "The home guard has been sent back...Strict action will be taken," said Jalaun SP Ravi Kumar.

342.title: SpiceJet defaults on depositing PF amount to staff's accounts: Report
342.article_body: SpiceJet, which delayed the disbursal of salaries amongst employees for the second consecutive month, has reportedly not deposited PF amounts in staff’s accounts. The airline has also allegedly defaulted on depositing TDS with authorities. Meanwhile, a spokesperson said that while there has been a deferral on discharging of payments, there has been no default on any statutory payments.

343.title: Will provide LPG cylinder at ₹500: Rahul in poll-bound Gujarat
343.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi promised a loan waiver of up to ₹3 lakh to farmers and LPG cylinders at ₹500 instead of the current price of ₹1,000 if the party comes to power in the state. He also announced free electricity to farmers and up to 300 units of free power to general consumers.

344.title: Guj is one state where you've to take permission before protesting: Rahul
344.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that Gujarat has become the "centre of drugs". "All drugs are moved from Mundra port...government doesn't take any action...This is the Gujarat model," he said in Ahmedabad. "Gujarat is one state where you have to take permission before protesting, permission from those against whom protest will be done," he stated.

345.title: Kerala church stops use of coffins, opts for nature-friendly burials
345.article_body: In a break from tradition, a Catholic church has decided to stop using caskets to bury the dead. The body will instead be wrapped in a plain linen cloth and lowered into the tomb. Parish priest Father Johnson Thaundiyil said that it will speed up decomposition. "We are returning to the simple, nature-friendly burial practice," he said.

346.title: BMC to install portable clinics in Mumbai slums amid surge in viral infections
346.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to set up 15 porta cabin clinics and 13 polyclinics in Mumbai's slum areas which will be operational by the end of this month. The move comes after Mumbai recorded a spike in viral infections and vector-borne diseases. The clinics will operate in two shifts from 7 am to 10 pm.

347.title: Rainfall activity likely to increase in Pune from September 8: IMD
347.article_body: The rainfall activity is likely to increase in Pune city from September 8, according to India Meteorological Department (IMD). Officials from the weather department said there'll be continuous rainfall from September 11 to September 13 and the last day of Ganpati Visarjan is likely to witness more rainfall. Reportedly, the Pune district reported 31% excess rainfall during the monsoon season.

348.title: Guys like Pant, Hooda need to learn the way Kohli runs between wickets: Gambhir
348.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said all youngsters in Team India need to learn the way Virat Kohli runs between the wickets. "Suryakumar might have more shots...but Virat is never under pressure because of the way he runs, the way he converts ones into twos," explained Gambhir.
