"Not every time you'll be able to hit those big shots," he added.

349.title: 24-yr-old rape survivor fails 'virginity' test in Raj, forced to pay ₹10 lakh
349.article_body: A 24-year-old bride was allegedly tortured, beaten and forced to undergo a chastity (virginity) test in Rajasthan's Bhilwara district. A penalty of ₹10 lakh was also imposed on the rape survivor's family by the khap panchayat after she failed the test. Her father-in-law, despite knowing about the incident, made her go through the humiliation, a police official said.

350.title: Police constable in Pune injured after being attacked by criminal
350.article_body: A police constable in Pune was injured after Akash alias Bhavdya Bharat Kudale, a criminal, attacked a team of police officers from Pimpri-Chinchwad which was there to arrest him. Officials said that the injured police constable, identified as Amol Gulab Mane, is currently undergoing medical treatment in a private hospital. Mane was attacked when he was questioning the accused.

351.title: Parts of Somalia to face famine in October and December: UN
351.article_body: The United Nations has issued a warning that parts of Somalia will face a famine between October and December amid rising global food prices and worsening drought. According to experts, the Horn of Africa might face a failed rainy season for a fifth consecutive time. In 2011, Somalia faced more than quarter of a million deaths due to a famine.

352.title: It was a costly miss but it happens: Jaffer on Arshdeep dropping Asif's catch
352.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that Arshdeep Singh's catch drop can't be blamed for India's defeat against Pakistan in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match. "There's no doubt that it was a costly miss...but it happens in cricket at times...you can't just blame a [dropped] catch," he stated. Arshdeep dropped Asif Ali's catch in the 18th over.

353.title: 150 mobile tanks for Ganpati immersion deployed across Pune
353.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) deployed 150 mobile tanks for Ganpati immersion across the city on Sunday. Dr Ketaki Ghadge, Assistant Health Officer, PMC's solid waste management department, said, "Apart from that, 303 permanent tanks are also constructed in various parts of the city, and 216 idol donation spots [were] set up." Some residents also immersed the idols in rivers.

354.title: Around 10,000 sanitation workers to work for Ganesh immersion in Hyderabad
354.article_body: Around 10,000 sanitation workers, 280 cranes along with 100 swimmers with boats will be employed at all the water bodies in Hyderabad on September 9 for Ganesh idol immersion, GHMC Mayor Gadwal Vijayalaxmi said. As per the Mayor's directions, at every 3 to 4 kilometres there should be 25 sanitation employees, and around 14 volunteers to operate cranes.

355.title: Manmohan Singh selected me as professor at IIT Delhi in 1970: Swamy
355.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy recalled his first meeting with former PM Manmohan Singh. "[In] 1970, I was selected by Manmohan as an Economics Professor at IIT Delhi. He chaired the 10-member selection committee and unanimously got me chosen against all Communists screaming away," Swamy tweeted. He added, "In 1990...I got him selected as [an] Economic Adviser to ex-PM Chandra Shekhar."

356.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is no 'Mann Ki Baat', it's about concern for people: Cong
356.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Monday said 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is not a 'Mann Ki Baat' in any manner. "It's about the concern for people. Its objective is to ensure that the concerns and demands expressed by the people reach Delhi," Ramesh added. "It (yatra) is not about long speeches, preaching, dramatics [or] teleprompter, we're going to listen," he stated.

357.title: Boy steals women's undergarments in Gwalior; caught on CCTV camera
357.article_body: A ladies' undergarments thief is running amok in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior, a report said. Police have registered a case after a businessman reported that a boy entered his house in the middle of the night and stole his wife's undergarments. He was also caught on CCTV camera. Meanwhile, police have identified the accused as a local living in the area.

358.title: Govt committed to privatisation, bank reforms amid challenges: FM
358.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India is the fastest growing economy despite global headwinds. During her address at an event, Sitharaman said the government is committed to privatising PSU enterprises. She emphasised that India will have to reset a lot of things to be a developed nation by 2047, calling digitisation, education and infrastructure the biggest tools.

359.title: I don't think any film can tank because of boycott trend: Goldie on 'Liger'
359.article_body: Filmmaker Goldie Behl, when asked if Vijay Deverakonda's 'Liger' failed because of the boycott trend, said, "No, I don't think so any film can tank at...box office because of a trend of boycotting...film." He added no trend can stop a good film from succeeding. He further said if a film connects with the audience, nothing can stop it from succeeding.

360.title: At times I feel bad: Bhavana on actors making fun of Chunky Panday
360.article_body: Bhavana Pandey, wife of actor Chunky Panday, said on 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' that she sometimes feels bad when her husband's co-actors make fun of him. "Sometimes I'm like, 'Why do you allow them?'," she added. Chunky, however, said that he feels he should always be the topic of discussion whether good or bad.

361.title: KRK seems to be victim of conspiracy: Shatrughan Sinha on his arrest
361.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha has defended Kamaal R Khan after the latter was arrested by Malad Police last week over the tweets he posted in 2020. "He seems to be a victim of a conspiracy of circumstances...wish...that KRK gets justice which he deserves soon," Shatrughan tweeted. KRK was arrested again on Monday for demanding sexual favours in a 2019 case.

362.title: BJP releases 'sting video' to claim AAP leaders took money under excise policy
362.article_body: BJP has released 'sting videos' to claim Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and deputy CM Manish Sisodia took "commissions" worth "hundreds of crores" to benefit private players under the now scrapped excise policy. BJP said, "Why was the older policy, and then new one, withdrawn; why were blacklisted companies given contracts and why was the commission increased from 2% to 12%?"

363.title: Uddhav ditched BJP by breaking alliance in 2014 for seeking 2 seats: Shah
363.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said Shiv Sena President Uddhav Thackeray ditched BJP by breaking their alliance in 2014 for seeking two seats. "Uddhav Thackeray betrayed BJP after seeking votes on the names of (Prime Minister) Narendra Modi and (Maharashtra Deputy CM) Devendra Fadnavis," Shah said. "Those who ditch somebody in politics never become successful," he added.

364.title: J'khand govt obstructing probe into 2 minor girls' deaths: NCPCR chief
364.article_body: NCPCR chief Priyank Kanoongo, who reached Jharkhand's Dumka to probe deaths of two minor girls, said the state government is "very uncooperative" and is "obstructing the investigation". "A team of NCPCR wanted to meet the family of the girl who was hanged after rape…After coming to the village, however, her parents could not be found," tweeted Kanoongo.

365.title: CBI officer died by suicide as he was pressured to frame me in fake case: Manish Sisodia
365.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia claimed a CBI officer died by suicide as he was pressured to frame him in a "fake case". "He wasn't permitting it...Pressure was being mounted to make a false case legally sound," Sisodia added. Sisodia's remarks come after BJP claimed he took "commissions" worth "crores" to benefit private players under the now scrapped excise policy.

366.title: RERA warns of action against agents charging arbitrary brokerage in G'gram
366.article_body: The Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority (HRERA) warned real estate agents of action against charging arbitrary brokerage from property buyers and sellers. The authority issued a warning to 1,840 agents in Gurugram. "We will revoke, blacklist and debar agents or brokers who charge exorbitant commissions in contravention of the rule," HRERA Gurugram Chairman KK Khandelwal said.

367.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib jailed for corruption seeks royal pardon
367.article_body: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak, who was sentenced to 12 years of imprisonment for corruption, has applied for a royal pardon, the country's Parliament Speaker said on Monday. In August, Malaysia's top court upheld Najib's conviction in state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad corruption case. Najib will lose his parliamentary seat only if the petition is rejected, the Parliament Speaker added.

368.title: BJP leader Kirpal Singh shot dead in Rajasthan, police suspect gang rivalry
368.article_body: BJP leader Kirpal Singh, a close aide of BJP MP from Rajasthan's Bharatpur Ranjeeta Koli, was shot dead in the city on Sunday. The assailants opened fire at Kirpal while he was going home from circuit house in his car. Police suspect the killing to be a result of gang rivalry. "The accused are being identified," a police official said.

369.title: I feel guilty I'm unable to spend time with newborn son: Dheeraj Dhoopar
369.article_body: Actor Dheeraj Dhooper has said he feels guilty as he is unable to spend "enough time" with his newborn son. Speaking about his busy schedule, Dheeraj said he wished he had 50 hours in a day. "The 24 hours I have, I'm just going all out...doing everything that's needed," he added. The actor is part of 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'.

370.title: Had Nawaz not scored, Pak wouldn’t have reached till the end: Sehwag
370.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag has said all-rounder Muhammad Nawaz played the most impactful innings among the Pakistan batters while chasing India's 182-run target. "Had Nawaz not scored 40 off 22 deliveries, Pakistan would not have reached till the end...helped take the pressure off Rizwan," stated Sehwag. Nawaz and Rizwan added 73 runs off 41 balls.

371.title: Researchers working on app to detect COVID-19 using users' voice samples
371.article_body: Researchers at Netherland's Maastricht University on Monday said they're working on a smartphone app that can accurately detect COVID-19 infection in people's voices with the help of artificial intelligence. They claimed that the app is more accurate than several antigen tests. The app's results have a turnaround time of less than a minute, a researcher said.

372.title: Video shows policeman clearing waterlogged B'luru street with stick
372.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police on Monday shared a video showing a policeman clearing the waterlogged Spice Garden. Several parts of the city were severely waterlogged and traffic was affected due to heavy rains. Bengaluru recorded 131.6 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

373.title: Centre abolishes 3,000 CISF posts at airports, Congress criticises move
373.article_body: The Centre has decided to abolish 3,049 CISF aviation security posts, which will be replaced by 1,924 private security personnel at various airports. The Congress criticised the move saying the government is playing with the security of the airports. "Actions in the name of cutting down on security expenses cannot be tolerated," said the party.

374.title: BJP trying to create civil war-like situation in country: Soren
374.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Monday said that the BJP is trying to create a "civil war-like situation in the country by fuelling riots to win elections". Soren made the statement during a state Assembly session convened to hold trust motion. "The BJP has been indulging in horse-trading of legislators," he added.

375.title: Sanjay Raut’s custody extended till September 19 in land scam case
375.article_body: A special PMLA court extended Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut’s judicial custody till September 19. He was arrested by the ED on August 1 after over six hours of questioning in the ₹1,034-crore Patra Chawl land scam case. Earlier in August, Raut’s wife was also questioned by the probe agency in connection to the same case.

376.title: 6 booked for torturing, assaulting doctor over dowry in Gurugram
376.article_body: Gurugram Police have registered an FIR against a man and his five family members, for allegedly subjecting his wife, a doctor of the Haryana government, to cruelty and mental and physical torture for dowry. Police said that the doctor had also alleged that she was subjected to unnatural sex by her husband.

377.title: 19-year-old man arrested for raping class 8 student in Gurugram
377.article_body: A 19-year-old man was arrested by the Gurugram Police for allegedly raping a class 8 student. The accused, Shiva, allegedly laced a drink with some sedatives and then raped the 14-year-old girl at an isolated place, police said. Notably, Shiva works with a Manesar-based private company and has been currently sent to 14-day judicial custody, police added.

378.title: Appears to be handiwork of another IT cell: Panag on Arshdeep being trolled
378.article_body: Actress Gul Panag defended pacer Arshdeep Singh on Twitter after the latter was trolled for dropping a catch during India versus Pakistan Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. "Truly tragic the way Arshdeep has been trolled...it appears to be the handiwork of another IT cell," Panag tweeted. Arshdeep had dropped Asif Ali's catch in the 18th over.

379.title: SC notice to ECI over plea against political parties using religion symbols
379.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday issued a notice to the Election Commission of India (ECI) following a plea to cancel symbols and names allotted to political parties which use religion or religious connotations. The plea states using religion to lure voters is strictly prohibited under section 123 of The Representation of People Act, 1951 citing the secular values of the Constitution.

380.title: Gurugram district reports 1st death related to lumpy skin disease
380.article_body: Gurugram district on Friday reported its first death related to the lumpy skin disease. The Deputy Director of Haryana's Animal Husbandry and Dairying Department, Dr Punita Gahlawat said that a one-year-old Heifer cow has died in Pataudi's Noorgarh village. As per the department, 94 cases of the disease have been detected in 24 areas in the district.

381.title: BJP attempting to destabilise democratically elected state govts: J'khand CM
381.article_body: BJP is attempting to destabilise democratically elected state governments in non-BJP ruled states, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said on Monday in state Assembly. "Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma indulged in purchase of Jharkhand MLAs," Soren added during the confidence motion. "They want to create an atmosphere of civil war and want to fan riots to win polls," he stated.

382.title: Bengaluru sees wettest September day since 2014
382.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday saw the wettest September day since 2014, with a rainfall of 131.6 mm in the last 24 hours. Several parts of the city were heavily waterlogged and traffic was affected due to the downpour. Traffic police asked people to avoid Outer Ring Road, Sarjapura Road, Doddakannelli Road and Bellandur Road.

383.title: 8 killed as 5.3 magnitude earthquake hits Afghanistan
383.article_body: At least eight people were killed after an earthquake hit northeastern Afghanistan on Monday, the state news agency reported. According to the United States Geological Survey (USGS), the 5.3 magnitude earthquake struck near the city of Jalalabad. Afghanistan was hit by a strong earthquake in June in which more than 1,000 people were killed.

384.title: Israeli Prez visits Germany to commemorate Munich Olympics massacre
384.article_body: Israeli President Isaac Herzog has arrived in Germany for a three-day visit. He will join a commemoration ceremony for the 50th anniversary of the massacre at the 1972 Munich Olympics. Relatives of the victims, who had initially declined, will attend the commemoration. On Tuesday, Herzog will give a speech in the German Parliament and will visit a former concentration camp.

385.title: Thieves drill hole in TN shop's wall, pass out after drinking liquor they came to steal
385.article_body: Two men were arrested in Tamil Nadu after they allegedly drilled a hole in the wall of a liquor shop and ended up passing out in the shop after drinking the same liquor they had come to steal. The police also recorded a video of how they came out of the same hole they had drilled for the theft.

386.title: Kyrgios played like Nadal, Djokovic: Medvedev on US Open 4th round loss
386.article_body: After defending champion Daniil Medvedev crashed out of US Open 2022 following his loss against 23rd seed Nick Kyrgios, Medvedev said that the Australian played to the level of Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic in the fourth round. "It was a high-level match...He [Kyrgios] is tough to play," he added. Kyrgios defeated world number one Medvedev 7-6(13-11), 3-6, 6-3, 6-2.

387.title: Porsche IPO is a 'key element' of our strategy: Volkswagen CFO
387.article_body: Volkswagen CFO Arno Antlitz has said the planned listing of Porsche is a "key element" of the firm's strategy. Its management and supervisory boards are to discuss the possibility of an IPO at September end or early October amid troubled global markets. Antlitz added the possible IPO proceeds would give the firm more flexibility to further accelerate its transformation.

388.title: Hyderabad Madrassa teacher sent to judicial custody for sodomising minor
388.article_body: A Hyderabad Madrassa teacher has been sent to judicial custody after he was arrested for allegedly sodomising a 14-year-old minor in the Santosh Nagar area. "A case was filed under the relevant sections of POCSO after the victim’s family filed a complaint against the teacher...The accused was arrested and has been sent to judicial remand,” police said.

389.title: Differently-abled girl kills self in UP hostel, no suicide note recovered
389.article_body: A 26-year-old differently-abled female student allegedly died by suicide in her hostel room on the campus of Dr Shakuntala Misra National Rehabilitation University (DSMNRU) here in Lucknow. Reports said that she was rushed to the Lok Bandhu hospital, where she was declared dead. Police said no suicide note has been recovered.

390.title: Foreign policies no longer impacted by vote bank politics: Jaishankar
390.article_body: Talking about India-Israel ties, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that those days are gone when vote bank politics impacted foreign policies. “We had some political reasons owing to which we did not further our ties with Israel. We restricted ourselves. PM Modi was the first PM in the history of India to have visited Israel,” said Jaishankar.

391.title: S Korea raises typhoon alert to 'very strong', many flights cancelled
391.article_body: South Korea has raised the typhoon alert as the south of the country witnessed heavy rains and strong winds. Typhoon Hinnamnor led to flight cancellation, school closure and suspension of business operations. Warnings have been issued in southern cities of Busan, Gwangju, Daegu, Ulsan and Jeju. Hinnamnor has been categorised as a "very strong" typhoon.

392.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar likely to meet opposition leaders in Delhi today
392.article_body: According to reports, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is expected to meet prominent leaders in the national capital today to talk about strengthening opposition unity for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. “If all (opposition) parties fight together, the BJP will be packed...We will work on that. BJP has disrupted the social and communal harmony,” Kumar said during JD(U)'s executive meet.

393.title: Improvement in per capita income would have been satisfactory: Mayawati
393.article_body: As India overtook the UK to become the world’s fifth largest economy, former UP CM Mayawati said that it would have been satisfactory if figures showed improvement in per capita income. “Britain's per capita income is about 20 times more than India…If India achieves it, it will help in removing country’s problems like poverty and unemployment," said Mayawati.

394.title: Home Minister Amit Shah meets Rohit Shetty in Mumbai, shares pic
394.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, who is on a two-day visit to Mumbai, met filmmaker Rohit Shetty. Taking to Twitter, Shah shared a picture from the meeting and wrote, "Met noted director Rohit Shetty, today in Mumbai." 'Singham' director Rohit's upcoming directorial 'Indian Police Force' features actor Sidharth Malhotra and actress Shilpa Shetty.

395.title: Rajinikanth, Haasan to attend pre-release event of 'Ponniyin...'
395.article_body: Actors Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan will be attending the music and trailer launch event of Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One', Lyca Productions tweeted. "It can't get any bigger or better than this," the tweet further read. The event will take place on September 6. Vikram, Karthi and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan will feature in the film.

396.title: We were expecting short balls: Nawaz on scoring 42(20) vs India
396.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Muhammad Nawaz has said they were prepared for India's short-ball attack in their Asia Cup match on Sunday. "In the first match they got wickets from short balls, so we were expecting them to go that route again. We practiced with this thought in mind," he added. Nawaz smashed 42(20) to help Pakistan chase down India's 181-run total.

397.title: WhatsApp may soon allow users to text themselves across devices: Report
397.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature to allow users to message themselves from multiple devices linked to their accounts, WABetaInfo reported. The feature was spotted in the desktop beta. Once the feature is available to users, they will see a contact labeled 'You' in their chat list and they will be able to send messages to it via linked devices.

398.title: S Korean govt's YouTube channel hacked, streams Elon Musk's interview: Report
398.article_body: The South Korean government's YouTube channel was hacked on Saturday to stream the video of an interview with Tesla CEO Elon Musk, according to reports. The channel's name was changed to 'SpaceX Invest' and it showed a live broadcast on cryptocurrency. A government official said security measures were undertaken and the channel was restored about four hours after the hack.

399.title: UP CM Yogi orders joint probe into fire incident at Lucknow hotel
399.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday ordered a joint probe by the Divisional Commissioner and Police Commissioner of Lucknow into the fire incident at Hotel Levana in Hazratganj area. Two people were killed in the fire that broke out on Monday morning. Relief teams had to break the windows of the hotel with iron rods to rescue trapped people.

400.title: 30-yr-old woman killed by tanker while avoiding pothole in Thane
400.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was crushed to death by a tanker after she fell off her two-wheeler while avoiding a pothole in Maharashtra's Thane district on Sunday, police said. The victim, identified as Kavita Mhatre, was riding her scooter to work when she tried to avoid a pothole on the flyover and fell, an official from the city police said.

401.title: Suicide bomber blows himself up outside Russian embassy in Kabul, several feared dead
401.article_body: A suicide bomber blew himself up outside the the Russian embassy in Afghanistan's Kabul. Several people are feared to be dead in the attack. The Russian Foreign Ministry confirmed that at least two embassy staffers have been killed. As per the police, the suicide bomber was shot dead by the guards, but he still succeeded in detonating the device.

402.title: NIA court rejects Gautam Navlakha's bail plea in Elgar Parishad case
402.article_body: A special NIA court on Monday rejected the bail plea of activist Gautam Navlakha, who was arrested in connection with the Elgar Parishad case. The case pertains to alleged inflammatory speeches made at the Pune event in 2017. After being placed under house arrest initially, he was later sent to judicial custody at Navi Mumbai's Taloja prison.

403.title: Hyd college staffer injured in student leader's suicide bid, dies
403.article_body: Hyderabad's Narayana college's administration officer succumbed to burn injuries after a student leader's suicide bid at the college started a fire. The incident took place in August and a few people, including the student and the deceased, were injured. The student leader had doused himself in petrol and threatened to set himself on fire over a student's transfer certificate's non-issuance.
